repo_notes.content: IATF (Indexed Agent Traversable File) is a file format designed for AI agents to efficiently navigate large documents. It solves the token efficiency problem that AI agents face when working with large files by providing self-indexing capabilities with 80-95% token savings. The system includes CLI tools in Go and Python for building and managing IATF files, with support for section references, watch mode for auto-rebuilding, and comprehensive validation. The repository contains dual implementations in Go and Python, installers for Windows/macOS/Linux, examples, and extensive documentation.
repo_notes.author: Winds-AI

pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce the IATF (Indexed Agent Traversable File) system, explaining its core purpose of creating self-indexing documents optimized for AI agent navigation with 85% token savings

pages.title: System Architecture
pages.purpose: High-level overview of the complete IATF ecosystem including the file format, dual CLI implementations, packaging system, and how AI agents interact with the system

pages.title: Token Efficiency Model
pages.purpose: Explain how IATF achieves 85% token savings for AI agents through INDEX-based navigation, contrasting traditional full-document loading with IATF's selective section loading

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.purpose: Guide users through installing IATF tools and creating their first IATF document

pages.title: Installation
pages.purpose: Provide installation instructions for all supported platforms (Windows, macOS, Linux) including installer downloads and manual binary installation

pages.title: Quick Start Tutorial
pages.purpose: Walk through creating a first IATF document, running rebuild, and understanding the generated INDEX

pages.title: Basic Commands
pages.purpose: Introduce the five core commands (rebuild, rebuild-all, watch, unwatch, validate) with simple examples

pages.title: IATF File Format
pages.purpose: Comprehensive specification of the IATF file format including structure, syntax, and design principles

pages.title: Format Specification
pages.purpose: Detailed specification of IATF format including header, INDEX, and CONTENT sections with exact syntax rules

pages.title: INDEX Section
pages.purpose: Deep dive into the auto-generated INDEX section: structure, metadata fields, line number calculation, and content hashing

pages.title: CONTENT Section
pages.purpose: Explain CONTENT section structure including section blocks, metadata annotations (@summary, @created, @modified, @hash), and section references

pages.title: Section References
pages.purpose: Document the {@section-id} reference syntax, validation rules, and how references enable document cross-linking

pages.title: Validation Rules
pages.purpose: Comprehensive list of all validation checks performed by iatf validate including structure, consistency, accuracy, and freshness

pages.title: CLI Reference
pages.purpose: Complete command-line interface reference for both Go and Python implementations

pages.title: Command Overview
pages.purpose: Overview of all available commands with their purpose and common usage patterns

pages.title: rebuild Command
pages.purpose: Detailed documentation of the rebuild command including INDEX generation algorithm, metadata updates, and two-pass line number adjustment

pages.title: watch and unwatch Commands
pages.purpose: Explain file monitoring system including PID tracking, watch state management, and automatic rebuild triggers

pages.title: validate Command
pages.purpose: Document the 9-level validation pipeline from basic structure checks to reference validation and hash verification

pages.title: read and index Commands
pages.purpose: Document section extraction commands for reading specific sections by ID or title and outputting raw INDEX

pages.title: Go vs Python Implementation
pages.purpose: Compare the two CLI implementations discussing performance, distribution, and when to use each

pages.title: Building and Distribution
pages.purpose: Guide for building IATF tools from source and creating platform-specific installers

pages.title: Building from Source
pages.purpose: Instructions for compiling Go and Python implementations including cross-compilation for multiple platforms

pages.title: Windows Installer (MSI)
pages.purpose: Detailed guide for building Windows MSI packages using WiX Toolset including PATH modification and Start Menu integration

pages.title: macOS Installer (PKG)
pages.purpose: Guide for creating universal macOS PKG installers supporting both Intel and Apple Silicon architectures

pages.title: Linux Packages (DEB/RPM)
pages.purpose: Instructions for building Debian and RPM packages for multiple architectures (amd64, arm64)

pages.title: Automated Release Pipeline
pages.purpose: Document the GitHub Actions workflow that automatically builds binaries and installers for all platforms on tag push

pages.title: Development Guide
pages.purpose: Information for developers contributing to or extending the IATF system

pages.title: Project Structure
pages.purpose: Overview of the repository structure explaining the purpose of each directory and key files

pages.title: Internal Architecture
pages.purpose: Deep dive into the internal architecture including parsing algorithms, validation pipelines, and watch state management

pages.title: Watch System and PID Management
pages.purpose: Explain the watch state system, PID tracking, and the warning mechanism to prevent double rebuilds
